result.execSummary:
The defendant Dimitri C Boone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and assessments, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.    Any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civi judgment against the defendant.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with victim.
No contact with children under the age of 16.

Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Register and comply with the sex offender registry.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment,  while in custody also.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA smaple unless previously submitted, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting and child sex offender working with children.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dimitri C Boone

records.addlTxt: Per Order Dated November 13, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP918-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-30-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 12.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 12:
Defendant Dimitri C Boone in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Dimitri C Boone in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Br 12 is in trial.  Br 10 agreed to hear this matter for Br 12.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Protective Order, signed and filed.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court. Defendant not in court, in custody. Christopher A. Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Status Conference. State addresses discovery issue regarding a protective order. Defense responds. State is to provide an Order to the Court. 
Court addresses bail. Arguments by state and defense. Court orders bail to remain the same.
Motion for Modification of Bond, received and filed.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Dimitri C Boone not in court, in custody.  Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel informed the Court defendant wishes to hire a private attorney. Court will grant adjournment to allow defendant time to retain a private attorney. Attorney Opland-Dobs to appear at the next court date. If the defendant does not hire an attorney by the next date, Attorney Opland-Dobs will continue to be the attorney of record. Case adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 12.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dimitri C Boone in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Dimitri C Boone in custody.  Erin Karshen for Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Barbara Court-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.D.W. (DOB:  06/24/2000).

Defendant Dimitri C Boone in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Dimitri C Boone in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
